data.title: Mainly Art
data.text: Great place to visit. Mostly art though. Most of it Spanish artist. We were wanting to see the old architecture but most of it inside has been removed for the art. 3rd floor did have an exhibit on what a room looked like in the 1920's. the other side of the room showed the progress of homes from the 1910's-1940's. No photos are allowed in the museum.

data.title: Something for everyone
data.text: The Grace is a beautiful place for weddings or reunions. I love the Abilene displays with kitchen scenes from various decades. Great and varied art displays as well.

data.title: Beautiful and charming
data.text: Pretty impressive for a small town.  Always a pleseant suprise to find a gem where you don't expect it. Wonderful gallery

data.title: We Love The Grace!
data.text: As a teacher, I took students to The Grace for years. It just has a feel about it that is good for young people to experience. I normally visited with teens, but there are areas that are wonderful for young children as well. The restored old building is fantastic.

data.title: A Modern Museum, A Historic Location
data.text: The Grace, features every changing displays and varying art forms and a wonderful event center as well.

data.title: Very Nice Museum!
data.text: My son and I walked around your museum last Saturday as we traveled through Abilene on our way to summer camp.  Your museum is great!  The interactive kid museum was very neat.  You have a way cool place there!  Thanks for sharing it with us!

data.title: You will remember what you see here
data.text: This is a quality museum in a city that loves art. First floor has traveling exhibitons. The one we saw was exceptionally good with some very well-known artists. On the third floor is, what I believe, a permanent installation of a living-room and kitchen from circa 1910, 1928 and 1948. This would be facinating for anyone, but especially those 50 and above who will remember the actual experience.

data.title: Nicely curated
data.text: I particularly loved the 3rd floor history exhibition. It reminded me of the "Carousel of Progress" at Disney (minus the automatons, lol). I can tell someone put a lot of time and heart into it and I admire that. It's very nice, but small. There's a diverse little art exhibit on the first floor too. I'm not a huge art buff, but it was well organized and I like that there seemed to be something for everyone. It will take you about an hour to tour everything, two if you have kids to visit the children's area. I asked for a restaurant recommendation at the front and the girl put on an attitude that was possibly her perception that I was not from "round here," but the man was much more genial. Overall, I'd say it's worth a stop if you have $10 and an hour to kill.

data.title: Hidden secrets
data.text: An unusual art/history museum housed in an old hotel. Unique art pieces on main floor, then surprise exhibition of local student art on second floor. The high school art was particularly impressive. The third floor surprise was a step back in time to 1910, 1928, & 1948 with home life scenes from each. Upon leaving third floor don't miss the step-by-step demonstration of the making of cowboy boots. Time well spent.

data.title: Love Art? Love History? You'll LOVE this place!
data.text: Has several levels of art, history of Abilene and a floor dedicated to hands-on fun for toddlers and small children! Abilene is lucky to have a place like this.

data.title: Not Much Here
data.text:
We went to the museum after seeing advertisements about how it was an art exhibit and museum that focused on Abilene after the wild west days.  Well, the art was decidedly not western and the only thing close to a museum there was a series of rooms set up as they would have been in the 40's, 50's, 60's, etc.  There was nothing special about any of them although they were interesting.

We had a question about one item in the displays so went to the front desk and the lady said she had no idea because art was her forte.  But, she made no offer to find out.  There was another employee sitting next to her and he never even acknowledged we were even there.

While the art was fine, there was not a lot of it as the advertising had indicated.  Almost none was about Abilene, the area, or anything historical.  Basically, we found it to be a waste of time and greatly over rated.  We were very disappointed and would not recommend you go there unless you do want to see a little artwork.  Just don't go there expecting anything they advertise.

data.title: Step back in time
data.text: A beautiful and nostalgic display from years past make the trip to the Grace a pleasure.  Be sure to see all the floors when you go!

data.title: Good local history
data.text: This is a good historical museum.  Small but well done.  Kids play/project room.  Also a kids science room, and play theatre. Makes a good 2 hour visit for kids.

data.title: Awesome displays!
data.text: This is an Awesome museum!  It has a kids activity center, to displays of Abilene's past.  It is a very well kept museum and well worth stopping in and seeing it!

data.title: Nice Little Museum
data.text: Located in a beautiful old building this is a great place to escape the summertime Texas heat and enjoy the small galleries.

data.title: Wedding
data.text: I was there for a wedding, so I cannot speak for the actual "museum" part, but it was a very cool building in the heart of downtown Abliene. Loved the rooftop reception area. It was a perfect West Texas night.

data.title: Kid friendly
data.text: Great place to take the kids and let them roam the discovery room. I hope they plan to expand this in the future as it is truly a unique and fun experience for the kids.

data.title: Enjoyed the hands on childrens section.
data.text: I was visiting with a broad range of age groups.... and all girls.  They enjoyed the hands on section (2nd floor), I enjoyed seeing the different rooms depicting the life in the early teens to somewhat modern times. I appreciate the dedication to preserving history and The Grace Museum has done a wonderful job.

data.title: Surprising quality
data.text: What a fantastic place to visit.  The art shows are unique and so interesting, and the children's museum is far superior to ones I've visited in major U. S. cities.  Very well done!

data.title: A fun place to visit
data.text: Go.  Just go...you will be glad you did.  Exhibits and hands-on activities for children can't be beat.  Try the "musical wall."  Adults love it as much as the kids.  What are you waiting for?
